action.action-desc: Mr. Ezell introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To establish the position of Secretary of the Coast Guard, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Secretary of the Coast Guard Act of 2025.

subsection.text: Subtitle I of title 14, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting after section 105 the following:

section.header: Secretary of the Coast Guard defined
section.text: In this title, the term Secretary of the Coast Guard means the Secretary of the Coast Guard established in section 201.

paragraph.text: by inserting after section 107, as so redesignated, the following:

subsection.text: There is a Secretary of the Coast Guard, appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

Subject to the authority, direction, and control of the Secretary, the Secretary of the Coast Guard shall exercise the powers of the Secretary in section 501, and other duties as may be prescribed by law or by the President or Secretary, in directing the Coast Guard.
The Secretary of the Coast Guard shall report directly to the Secretary without being required to report through any other official of the department in which the Coast Guard is operating.
The Commandment shall report directly to the Secretary of the Coast Guard.
The analysis for chapter 1 of title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 106 and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: 106. Secretary of the Coast Guard defined.
